biblStruct.note: Our aim in the present article is to offer a study of the different ‘translation strategies’ used by the translator of the Arabic Apocalypse of the Virgin, which was done from a Syriac original. Far from prove that we are in front of a translators school, text analyses show us that these strategies are not the result of a convention established by the Christian Arab translators, but the outcome of solving those needs which were experienced by translators separately.
